title: 'It's similar to how Google can map your home without your consent': Why using aerial lasers to map an archaeology site should have Indigenous partnership
summary: Aerial lidar is transforming how archaeologists map sites, but they should do it in tandem with Indigenous people.

title: A New Hostess Spring Snack Lineup Is On The Way & Fans Are Already Calling Dibs
summary: People are already mentally clearing shelf space.

title: How to Use Physics to Escape an Ice Bowl
summary: Here are three smart tricks, based on an understanding of frictional forces, to beat a slippery slope.

title: Rare medieval seal discovered in UK is inscribed with 'Richard's secret' and bears a Roman-period gemstone
summary: The Gosfield seal is made of a medieval silver seal bezel surrounding an ancient Roman gemstone.

title: Stellar nursery bursts with newborn stars in hauntingly beautiful Hubble telescope image — Space photo of the week
summary: A new image from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope shows the Lupus 3 cloud in Scorpius bursting with young stars that are forming within collapsing clouds of gas and dust.

title: When were boats invented?
summary: The oldest physical boat is a canoe from roughly 10,000 years ago, but evidence suggests humans have been using watercraft for at least 50,000 years.

title: صدمة للدروس الخصوصية.. إقبال على حصص الإنترنت بمصر
summary: تتلقى الدروس الخصوصية صدمة قوية في مصر حاليا، مع تزايد الإقبال بشكل ملحوظ حصص التعليم عبر الإنترنت، والصفحات الخاصة بعدد من مشاهير المعلمين عبر مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي، وموقع "يوتيوب"، والتي تقدم الخدمات المجانية للطلاب من مراحل التعليم المختلفة.

title: Life may have rebounded 'ridiculously fast' after the dinosaur-killing asteroid impact
summary: After the asteroid smashed into Earth around 66 million years ago, it didn't take life that long to rebound, a new study finds.

title: James Webb telescope solves mystery of 'forever young' vampire stars from the dawn of time
summary: Astronomers have discovered how "forever young" stars stay blue and bright despite being almost as old as the universe.

title: How long does it take the sun to rotate?
summary: The time it takes for the sun to completely rotate depends where on the sun you are measuring.

title: Google Workspace Promo Code: Up to 14% Off in 2026
summary: Boost your productivity and save with exclusive Google Workspace coupons from WIRED. Get up to 14% off plans for three months, including Starter, Standard, and Plus tiers.

title: 'Part of the evolutionary fabric of our societies': Same-sex sexual behavior in primates may be a survival strategy, study finds
summary: A new study comparing 59 species of primates linked same-sex sexual behavior to scarce resources and more predators in socially complex species. The findings show diverse sexual behaviors are common — and likely beneficial in primates.

title: More than 43,000 years ago, Neanderthals spent centuries collecting animal skulls in a cave; but archaeologists aren't sure why
summary: Neanderthals repeatedly returned to the cave to store horned animal skulls, revealing this cultural tradition was transmitted over time.

title: The Snow Moon will 'swallow' one of the brightest stars in the sky this weekend: Where and when to look
summary: On the night of Feb. 2, skywatchers in eastern North America can see the moon occult Regulus — a rare event visible to the naked eye.

title: James Webb telescope discovers closest galaxy to the Big Bang ever seen
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has confirmed the most distant, early galaxy in the known universe. The new contender, MoM-z14, is visible just 280 million years after the Big Bang.

title: Stone Age teenager was mauled by a bear 28,000 years ago, skeletal analysis confirms
summary: The mystery of a Stone Age teenager's death has been solved — 80 years after he was found in an ancient burial ground in Italy.

title: February 2026 night sky: What to see and what you need
summary: The best of February’s stargazing events — with key dates and the must-have gear to see them at their best.

title: Romans used human feces as medicine 1,900 years ago — and used thyme to mask the smell
summary: A new study shows that organic residues from a Roman-era glass medicinal vial came from human feces.

title: Teenage girl who lived in Italy 12,000 years ago had a rare form of dwarfism, DNA study shows
summary: In 1963, researchers unearthed two Stone Age skeletons that were buried in an embraced position in a cave in Italy. Now, DNA testing has revealed that one of them had a rare genetic condition.

title: New study of chemical reactions in space 'could impact the origin of life in ways we hadn't thought of'
summary: The complex building blocks of life can form spontaneously in space, a new lab experiment shows.

title: 430,000-year-old wooden handheld tools from Greece are the oldest on record — and they predate modern humans
summary: Archaeologists have found the oldest-known surviving examples of handheld wooden tools.

title: Giant 'metal cloud' spotted in nearby star system could be hiding a second alien sun
summary: Astronomers suspect that a massive metallic cloud swirling in a nearby star system could be hiding a giant planet or dwarf star from view, after it drastically dimmed a sun-like star for around nine months.

title: NASA is preparing for simulated launch of Artemis II mega moon rocket — and it could happen as early as Saturday
summary: NASA has announced it will fuel the Artemis II rocket as part of a simulated launch that will take place as early as Saturday (Jan. 31).

title: See February's full Snow Moon rise this weekend next to a glittering star cluster
summary: February's full "Snow Moon" will be at its fullest on Sunday, Feb. 1, and will be best seen at moonrise. It will appear just beneath the Beehive Cluster, one of the closest star clusters to the solar system.

title: 160,000-year-old sophisticated stone tools discovered in China may not have been made by Homo sapiens
summary: Archaeologists have found the oldest known evidence of hafted tools in East Asia, and they challenge a previously held assumption about stone tool use.

title: دمية "الحصان الباكي" تحصد الإعجاب في الصين
summary: في مدينة ييوو للتجارة الدولية، أكبر سوق للجملة في الصين، يتزاحم الزبائن في متجر صغير بحثا عن سلعة رائجة بشكل غير متوقع قبل حلول السنة القمرية الجديدة.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.

title: رهان على مصير مادورو.. شخص مجهول عرف قبل الجميع
summary: حقق مقامر أرباحا تقارب نصف مليون دولار من رهانٍ على اعتقال الرئيس الفنزويلي نيكولاس مادورو، قبل الإعلان الرسمي عن العملية، ما أثار تساؤلات حول احتمال استفادة جهات من معلومات داخلية تتعلق بالتحرك الأميركي.
